channel.title: Port forwarding problem?
channel.description:
ok yeah extremely noob question, but I am having some trouble port forwarding... I could swear I've done everything right lol.. I enabled the classpath/path stuff on my computer updated to the proper JDK and everything. I download NO-IP DUC I added my host for NO-IP DUC, I have the program open, I have the box beside my server name checked, all thats settled. Then I checked in my client to make sure it was connected to the right server name (example as of what im talking about: scape.no-ip.org) It was all set perfectly.. However I start the server, and I load up the client. but when I try to log in it doesn't work. The client works if I change the server thing to 127.0.0.1 so I know the client is fine, I just screwed up somewhere and idk where. Do these ports look coorect? [img]http://img515.imageshack.us/img515/6878/portforwardt.png[/img]
I set all the ports to 43594 ^

item.title: Port forwarding problem?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

127.0.0.1 is for the hoster to connect and no-ip is for other players to connect. You probably used no-ip to connect instead of 127.0.0.1. Also, if no one can connect using your no-ip then you have not properly portforward if you used default gateway its gonna give you that lan error so try the ipv4 address and try working with the protocols or use portforward.com and search for your router model

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding problem?
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

tried that before already. i get this error when I put an ip the lan field.

Non-numeric input in Port field!

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding problem?
item.dc:creator: @Skill_3D Skill 3D
item.description:
@Skill_3D wrote:

LAN Port is 192.168.1.###. That’s where you go to start/run/cmd and type, ‘ipconfig’. It is the number to the right of where it says Ip Address.

Read full topic

item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

ok yeah extremely noob question, but I am having some trouble port forwarding…
I could swear I’ve done everything right lol…
I enabled the classpath/path stuff on my computer updated to the proper JDK and everything.
I download NO-IP DUC
I added my host for NO-IP DUC, I have the program open, I have the box beside my server name checked, all thats settled.
Then I checked in my client to make sure it was connected to the right server name (example as of what im talking about: scape.no-ip.org)
It was all set perfectly…
However I start the server, and I load up the client. but when I try to log in it doesn’t work. The client works if I change the server thing to 127.0.0.1 so I know the client is fine, I just screwed up somewhere and idk where.

I set all the ports to 43594 ^
